intro: Laurentia hedyotidea var. major, commonly known as the greater laurentia, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Small white or pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters, typically in the axils of the leaves. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks.
